channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for February 14, 2026: With Not My Job guest Arden Cho
item.description: This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with guest host Negin Farsad, special guest Arden Cho and panelists Tom Papa, Paula Poundstone, and Beth Stelling
item.content:encoded:
This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with guest host Negin Farsad, special guest Arden Cho and panelists Tom Papa, Paula Poundstone, and Beth Stelling

(Image credit: Alberto E. Rodriguez)

item.title: Meet the power couples of the 2026 Winter Games, from rivals to teammates
item.description: Some of these power couples span multiple sports, while others compete in the same discipline — or even on the same team.
item.content:encoded:
Some of these power couples span multiple sports, while others compete in the same discipline — or even on the same team.











(Image credit: Michael Steele)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: What makes a good book-to-film adaptation? We have thoughts (and favorites)
item.description: Little Women (2019), Blade Runner (1982) and more favorites from NPR staff.
item.content:encoded:
Little Women, written and directed by Greta Gerwig.'/>

Little Women (2019), Blade Runner (1982) and more favorites from NPR staff.

(Image credit: Moviestore Collection Ltd)
item.dc:creator: Glen Weldon

item.title: Dear Life Kit: I officiated their wedding. Now I think they should get a divorce
item.description: An NPR listener says they've become increasingly concerned by their friends' marriage and feels a sense of duty to fix their relationship problems. Can they tell them what they really think?
item.content:encoded: An NPR listener says they've become increasingly concerned by their friends' marriage and feels a sense of duty to fix their relationship problems. Can they tell them what they really think?
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: A woman grieving her divorce found comfort from a couple on the trail
item.description: The news of Kristi Reeves' finalized divorce hit her hard, so she grabbed her shoes and headed for the mountains. On the trail, she encountered a couple.
item.content:encoded: The news of Kristi Reeves' finalized divorce hit her hard, so she grabbed her shoes and headed for the mountains. On the trail, she encountered a couple.

item.title: Oscar nominee Wagner Moura talks about the spirituality of the stage
item.description: Wagner Moura is the first-ever Brazilian to be nominated for the Oscar for Best Actor for his role in "The Secret Agent." On Wild Card, he reflected on his career on stage.
item.content:encoded: Wagner Moura is the first-ever Brazilian to be nominated for the Oscar for Best Actor for his role in "The Secret Agent." On Wild Card, he reflected on his career on stage.

item.title: Kitty cats and cloud hands — how U.S. Olympic snowboarders keep calm in competition
item.description: U.S. snowboarders psych themselves up before competition with heavy metal and pop music, cat photos, and apparently many on the men's halfpipe team now do Qigong.
item.content:encoded:
.'/>

U.S. snowboarders psych themselves up before competition with heavy metal and pop music, cat photos, and apparently many on the men's halfpipe team now do Qigong.

(Image credit: Abbie Parr)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: 'Wuthering Heights' celebrates mad, passionate excess — but lacks real feeling
item.description: Emerald Fennell's extravagant adaptation of Emily Brontë's classic cares little for subtlety. Ultimately, this love affair is more photogenic than it is deeply moving.
item.content:encoded:
Emerald Fennell's extravagant adaptation of Emily Brontë's classic cares little for subtlety. Ultimately, this love affair is more photogenic than it is deeply moving.

(Image credit: Warner Bros. Pictures)
item.dc:creator: Justin Chang

item.title: Chloe Kim's protégé foiled her Olympic three-peat dreams. She's celebrating anyway
item.description: Korea's Gaon Choi, 17, rebounded from a hard fall to win gold — and end her role model's historic bid for three in a row in the Winter Olympic halfpipe.
item.content:encoded:
Korea's Gaon Choi, 17, rebounded from a hard fall to win gold — and end her role model's historic bid for three in a row in the Winter Olympic halfpipe.

(Image credit: Cameron Spencer)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Gothic lust, chair lust and big-league dreams are in theaters this weekend
item.description: A fever-dream of a "Wuthering Heights" adaptation is out this weekend starring Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi. And Stephen Curry-produced GOAT is a speedy, snazzily animated sports flick.
item.content:encoded: A fever-dream of a "Wuthering Heights" adaptation is out this weekend starring Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi. And Stephen Curry-produced GOAT is a speedy, snazzily animated sports flick.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello
